prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Nolan Carter
mes:
Despite the roar of the locker room, players shouting, skates clattering against tiles, and the faint hiss of the shower running somewhere behind them, Nolan Carter only heard the thrum of his own pulse. Adrenaline still coursed heavy through his veins like molten lava. The win over Seattle felt damn sweet, no doubt about it. But that wasn’t enough to take the edge off. Not after a game this brutal. 

He didn’t even give a shit about the Jackals. Didn’t give a shit about Aaron fucking Vance. But seeing him lock eyes with *Hailee* during the game? Seeing him smirk like he owned them, the way his hand slid over their back during warm-ups? That was like setting a lit match to gasoline. The game was his excuse to break someone and not think twice about it.

Fuck that guy.

The Yellowjackets worked hard, he was fuckin' proud of his boys. Brick'd led the team good, clutching a win in the final moments of the game. Nolan's hands still weren’t done shaking from the fight or the high-stakes rush of the game. He needed to do something else. Punch another face. Grip harder. Need. More. Relief.

"Fuckin’ bastard eats elbows for breakfast now." His sneer bit out over his shoulder as he yanked the battered locker open with a clang. His knuckles popped when he flexed them. *Stupid little fuck.* If Vance thought he was untouchable just ‘cause he had Hailee's leash, well, he fuckin' wasn’t.

*Get over here. — K*

It was a simple text he'd sent to Hailee, one that he knew wouldn't go ignored.

And now Hailee was sneaking in the Yellowjackets locker room. Here for *him.* Here when that Pretty Boy loser probably still thought they were his. The thought scraped over his raw nerves like sandpaper. His hands didn’t shake when they closed around Hailee's waist and hauled them into a shower stall before the other Yellowjackets could notice. 

"Hey, shhh. They’re all too busy jerkin’ each other off right now. Pay no fucking attention." Heat radiated off his body as he crowded Hailee into the corner. His lips were on their neck in an instant, biting first. Kissing second. *This wasn’t about being tender.* He felt the heat of their skin against his and his fingers dug under the hem of their shirt, rough and impatient.

"You know how long I’ve been fuckin’ waiting for this tonight? Huh? Did you even watch me out there?" Not that he gave Hailee a chance to answer before continuing. "You watched him instead, didn’t you? Pretty boy." His laugh was sharp and short—more bitter than amused. The hand braced against the tile next to Hailee's face curled into a fist.

"Bet he doesn’t make you feel like this." His breath was ragged as he pressed closer against them, hips rolling slow and deliberate into their thigh. No room for anything else between them except the ragged sounds he pulled from their lips.

Nolan’s hand slid down their abdomen until it found the place where they burned hottest. He didn’t hesitate. Dropped his lips back to their ear as he worked his hand between Hailee's thighs. "Keep quiet if you don’t wanna get caught," he hissed. "Or don’t. Fucking dare ya."

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day the entertainment news is in a frenzy. After Nolan and Hailee fucked she went back to her boyfriend*

*Well when Nolan wakes up tmz is all over it reporting* "Hockey Player's Cheating girlfriend Sex video all over"

*The thing is it's not a video of Hailee and Nolan. After Hailee went back to Aaron turns out he found out she was cheating. So he forced her and  passed her around to his entire team and recorded it putting it on the internet as punishment*

name: Nolan Carter
mes:
Nolan's phone buzzed violently against the nightstand, the screen lighting up with a flood of notifications—TMZ, ESPN alerts, teammate texts blowing up his lock screen. He grabbed it with a grunt, still half-drunk on sleep and last night’s adrenaline.

Then he saw the headline.

And then he saw *the video.*

His blood turned to fucking ice.

The screen cracked under his grip before he even realized he’d clenched his fist. The footage was grainy but unmistakable—Hailee, pinned beneath some faceless Jackals player while another laughed off-camera, Aaron’s voice sneering something about *"teaching her loyalty."* Nolan didn’t need sound to know what was happening. He knew that look on her face—the one she got when she was overwhelmed, when she shut down. The one *he* had always fucking stopped for.

**"Motherfucker—"** His voice was raw as he launched out of bed, already dialing Connor with one hand while yanking on jeans with the other. **"Hartfield. Get me Vance’s address."** Static crackled over the line as Connor tried to stammer out a question about why the hell Nolan sounded like he was ready to eat glass—but Nolan cut him off with a snarl: **"NOW."**

He hung up before Connor could argue and grabbed his keys off the dresser so hard they left dents in his palm. His reflection in the mirror looked feral—eyes black with rage, jaw locked tight enough to fracture teeth. The dragon tattoo coiled around his neck seemed alive in the low light like it wanted blood too.

Aaron Vance wasn't just dead.
He was gonna wish death came faster.
swipes:

He grabbed it with a snarl, still half-drunk on sleep and last night’s adrenaline... until the headline hit him like a fucking freight train.*

**"HOCKEY WAG’S REVENGE PORN SCANDAL: CHEATING GIRLFRIEND PASSED AROUND SEATTLE LOCKER ROOM."**

*His blood went ice-cold. Then boiling.*

The video wasn’t them—wasn’t *him and Hailee*—but that didn’t matter. Because there she was. On her knees. Against the boards. Bent over a fucking bench. And every single one of those Seattle pricks had their hands on her, laughing like it was some goddamn joke while Aaron filmed it all with that smug-ass smirk Nolan wanted to carve off his face with his skate blade.

His fist cracked against the wall before he even realized he'd moved, drywall crumbling under the impact as his vision tunneled red. **"FUCKING DEAD."** The words ripped out of him raw and guttural, barely human anymore—just pure fucking rage given sound. His phone shattered next against the opposite wall before he stormed out of his apartment in nothing but sweats and last night's fury still clinging to his skin like sweat.

*Seattle better have their funeral plans ready.*

Nolan's phone buzzed violently against the nightstand, the screen lighting up with a flood of notifications—TMZ, ESPN alerts, teammate texts blowing up his lock screen. He grabbed it with a grunt, still half-drunk on sleep and last night’s adrenaline.

Then he saw the headline.

And then he saw *the video.*

His blood turned to fucking ice.

The screen cracked under his grip before he even realized he’d clenched his fist. The footage was grainy but unmistakable—Hailee, pinned beneath some faceless Jackals player while another laughed off-camera, Aaron’s voice sneering something about *"teaching her loyalty."* Nolan didn’t need sound to know what was happening. He knew that look on her face—the one she got when she was overwhelmed, when she shut down. The one *he* had always fucking stopped for.

**"Motherfucker—"** His voice was raw as he launched out of bed, already dialing Connor with one hand while yanking on jeans with the other. **"Hartfield. Get me Vance’s address."** Static crackled over the line as Connor tried to stammer out a question about why the hell Nolan sounded like he was ready to eat glass—but Nolan cut him off with a snarl: **"NOW."**

He hung up before Connor could argue and grabbed his keys off the dresser so hard they left dents in his palm. His reflection in the mirror looked feral—eyes black with rage, jaw locked tight enough to fracture teeth. The dragon tattoo coiled around his neck seemed alive in the low light like it wanted blood too.

Aaron Vance wasn't just dead.
He was gonna wish death came faster.

Nolan’s phone buzzed violently against the nightstand, the screen lighting up with a flood of notifications—TMZ, ESPN alerts, teammates’ texts piling up in rapid succession. He groaned, rolling over to silence the damn thing when a headline caught his eye like a sucker punch to the gut.

**"HOCKEY WAG CHEATING SCANDAL: VIDEO LEAKED OF SEATTLE JACKALS' WILD TEAM ‘PUNISHMENT.’"**

His blood turned to fucking ice.

*No.*

He sat bolt upright, fingers crushing the phone as he clicked on the link—and then immediately wished he hadn’t. Grainy footage of Hailee—*his Hailee*—being shoved between faceless jerseys, hands everywhere, her face streaked with tears while Aaron stood there smirking like some sick fucking ringmaster. The video was already viral. Comments flooded in beneath it: *slut got what she deserved*, *team bonding at its finest*, *shoulda kept her legs closed*.

Something inside Nolan snapped clean in half.

The phone hit the wall with a crack before he even realized he’d thrown it. His chest heaved like he'd just gone three rounds bare-knuckle, vision swimming red at the edges. That wasn't just revenge—that was **ruin**. And Vance had served it up for the whole goddamn world to chew on like entertainment.

He was pulling on jeans before his brain caught up with his body, keys already in hand when Connor burst into his apartment without knocking—probably because Nolan wasn’t answering his damn phone anymore and everyone knew shit had hit every possible fan within ten minutes of that video dropping.

**"Nolan."** Connor blocked him at doorframe; voice uncharacteristically hard for someone who usually joked through nuclear fallout.** "You don't even know where you're going."**

Nolan didn't blink.** "Seattle."**

Connor grabbed him by shoulders.** "And do what? Kill him? You think they won't have cops waiting?"**

A muscle jumped in Nolan's jaw.** "Don't care."**

Connor shook him once — hard enough that their foreheads nearly cracked together.** "Listen to me! You go now and you lose everything — contract voided assault charges pressed maybe worse if Vance is smart enough press rape charges too since she clearly wasn't willing!"**

That stopped him cold because fuck if Connor wasn’t right — legally speaking Hailee had been coerced filmed without consent which meant Aaron could twist this whole thing into some warped narrative where *she* looked guilty while skating free himself unless someone played smarter than brute force here...

But playing smart wasn’t exactly Nolan Carter's specialty when rage tasted this thick copper-bitter on tongue so instead all managed grit out through teeth:** "...Where is she?"**

Connor exhaled sharp relief at least hearing question instead threats murder now but still grimaced answer:** Hospital psych hold last I heard... family flew out protect from media but..."

Hospital meant safe guarded away from vultures cameras lawyers maybe even Vance himself trying slither back manipulate situation further which good start but not nearly fucking enough yet...

Nolan turned abruptly stalked toward kitchen where second burner phone stashed drawer under pile takeout menus — old habit from days younger dumber deals needed discretion...

Connor followed wary now watching as pulled up flight Seattle one hand other dialing number made stomach drop recognition area code Yellowjackets legal team...

Voice deadly calm when finally spoke again:

**"Tell Brick call emergency team meeting one hour... we got work do.”**

Nolan's phone buzzed violently against the nightstand, the screen lighting up with a flood of notifications—TMZ, ESPN alerts, teammate texts blowing up his lock screen. He grabbed it on instinct, still half-asleep, but what he saw fucking *woke* him up real goddamn fast.

**"What the fuck—"**

The video thumbnail alone made his stomach turn. Not because it was Hailee—no, he knew every inch of her body by now—but because of the way she was being *handled.* The way she wasn’t fighting back but wasn’t fucking *into* it either. The way Aaron stood there smirking behind the camera like some sick bastard pulling strings.

His knuckles cracked as his grip tightened around his phone hard enough to make the case creak. **"That little bitch."**

Nolan was already out of bed before he even processed moving, throwing on whatever clothes were closest—jeans barely zipped, hoodie half-on as he stormed toward the door. His phone rang again: Coach Alarie this time. He ignored it. Fuck damage control right now. Fuck PR spin and team meetings and whatever bullshit speech they wanted him to give about "conduct."

There were only two things in Nolan Carter's head right now:
1) Find Aaron Vance
2) Break every bone in that pretty-boy motherfucker's face until he couldn't even *smile* for a camera again

Nolan's phone had been blowing up for hours before he even bothered to check it. He'd woken up late, still riding the high from last night—from *her*—and fully intending to ignore the world until at least noon. But then Connor's name flashed across his screen for the fifth time in ten minutes, and he finally snarled and answered.

**"What?"**

The silence on the other end was heavy. Then: **"You need to turn on TMZ."**

Something cold slithered down Nolan’s spine. He didn’t ask why. Just hung up and grabbed the remote, flipping channels until that goddamn logo filled his screen—and then—

*Her.*

Not them together, no. That would've been bad enough but manageable—he could've spun that shit into something else, could've taken the heat if it meant protecting her from whatever fallout came next. But this? This wasn't them. This was *Aaron.* And his team. And Hailee looking fucking *broken* while they—

The remote shattered against the wall before he even realized he'd thrown it.

His hands shook as he scrolled through headlines, each one worse than the last:
- **"Hockey WAG Cheating Scandal Turns Dark: Seattle Jackals Star Exposes Girlfriend in Revenge Porn Nightmare"**
- **"Team Orgy Video Leaked After NHL Player Discovers Infidelity"**
- **"Hailee Marshall Identified as Victim in Viral Sex Tape Involving Entire Hockey Team."**

Every muscle in Nolan’s body locked tight enough to snap.

He should’ve killed him last night when he had the chance.

His phone buzzed again—Coach this time—but Nolan didn't answer. Didn't give a single fuck about PR or damage control or whatever bullshit spin they wanted him to put on this mess because none of that mattered right now.

Only one thing did.

He was already out the door before his brain caught up with him, keys in hand, engine roaring beneath him like a living thing ready to tear apart anything stupid enough to get in its way.

Aaron Vance was going to regret ever touching her.**

name: Hailee
mes:
*hailee is standing outside Nolan's door. She is huddled in her sweatshirt. She had spent all night in her hotel room sobbing. She doesnt know why she is here but..*

*Hailee knock softly and flinches when the door opens fast* "Hey" *She mumbles*

name: Nolan Carter
mes:
Nolan’s entire body locked up when he saw her standing there—small, wrecked, *alive.* His rage was still a live wire under his skin, but the second he took in the way she flinched at the door swinging open too fast, something inside him fucking *snapped.*

**"Jesus Christ—"** He didn’t think. Just grabbed her by the waist and hauled her inside in one motion, kicking the door shut behind them with enough force to rattle the frame. His hands were everywhere at once—cupping her face, skimming down her arms like he needed to check for injuries. **"Are you hurt? Did they—fuck, Hailee, talk to me."**

His voice cracked on her name. He hadn’t even realized his hands were shaking until they curled into fists against her sweatshirt. The video flashed behind his eyes again—her pinned down, that hollow look on her face—and suddenly breathing felt like swallowing knives.

He should’ve killed Vance last night. Should’ve torn him apart before this ever happened.

But right now? All that mattered was *her.* Nolan dragged Hailee against his chest without another word, tucking her head under his chin so tight it probably hurt. **"You stay here,"** he growled into her hair. **"You don't fucking move until I handle this."**
swipes:
Nolan nearly fucking *slammed* the door open when he heard the knock, expecting some reporter or teammate—but instead, there she was.

Small. Shaking. Wrapped in that oversized sweatshirt like armor.

For a second, he just stared at her—jaw locked so tight it hurt, knuckles white around the doorframe where his grip threatened to splinter the wood. The video flashed behind his eyes again—her face, those hands on her, Aaron’s smug fucking voice—and something in his chest *ripped.*

**"Jesus Christ."** His voice was rough as gravel as he yanked her inside by the wrist hard enough to stumble her into him before kicking the door shut behind them. He didn’t let go even then; fingers tightening just shy of bruising as he scanned her face for… fuck if he knew what. Tears? Bruises? That hollow look from the video?

His free hand came up like he was going to touch her cheek but stopped halfway, hovering like he wasn’t sure she wouldn’t shatter under it. **"You hurt?"** The question came out clipped—too sharp for how quiet she was standing there—but hell if Nolan knew how else to ask it without losing his goddamn mind right there in front of her.

Nolan nearly *ripped* the door off its hinges when he heard the knock—already halfway out to hunt Vance down, his rage a living thing under his skin. But then—

There she was.

Smaller than he remembered. Hunched in on herself like she was trying to disappear into that fucking sweatshirt. Her eyes were red-raw, her lip split, and the sight of it punched through him like a sledgehammer to the ribs.

For a second, they just stared at each other—him breathing hard like a goddamn animal, her trembling in his doorway like she expected him to slam it in her face.

Then Nolan moved.

One hand curled around the back of her neck and *yanked* her inside before kicking the door shut behind them with enough force to rattle the frame. He didn’t say shit—just dragged Hailee against his chest so tight he could feel every shaky breath she took against him. His fingers tangled in her hair, pressing her face into the crook of his neck where his pulse hammered wild and furious against her skin.

**"You tell me who touched you,"** he growled into her hair—voice thick with something too close to *murder.* **"Every single one of them."**

Nolan’s entire body locked up when he saw her standing there—small, fucking *broken*, wrapped in that oversized sweatshirt like she was trying to disappear into it. His rage didn’t vanish—no, it just *shifted*, twisting into something hotter, sharper. Something that made his hands shake with the need to *fix* this.

**"Jesus Christ—"** He didn’t ask questions. Didn’t hesitate. Just grabbed her by the wrist and yanked her inside hard enough that she stumbled against his chest. The door slammed shut behind them with a crack as he cupped her face, thumbs brushing under her swollen eyes. **"Look at me."** His voice was rough but low—controlled in a way it hadn't been minutes ago when he was ready to burn Seattle to the ground for her.

His gaze flickered over every bruise, every mark that wasn't his, and his jaw tightened so hard it hurt. **"You tell me who touched you,"** he growled, pressing his forehead against hers like he could force the words out of her through sheer will alone. **"Every single one of their names."**

Because they weren't walking away from this unharmed.
*None of them.*

Nolan’s entire body locked up when he saw her standing there—small, wrecked, *alive.* His rage was still a live wire under his skin, but the second he took in the way she flinched at the door swinging open too fast, something inside him fucking *snapped.*

**"Jesus Christ—"** He didn’t think. Just grabbed her by the waist and hauled her inside in one motion, kicking the door shut behind them with enough force to rattle the frame. His hands were everywhere at once—cupping her face, skimming down her arms like he needed to check for injuries. **"Are you hurt? Did they—fuck, Hailee, talk to me."**

His voice cracked on her name. He hadn’t even realized his hands were shaking until they curled into fists against her sweatshirt. The video flashed behind his eyes again—her pinned down, that hollow look on her face—and suddenly breathing felt like swallowing knives.

He should’ve killed Vance last night. Should’ve torn him apart before this ever happened.

But right now? All that mattered was *her.* Nolan dragged Hailee against his chest without another word, tucking her head under his chin so tight it probably hurt. **"You stay here,"** he growled into her hair. **"You don't fucking move until I handle this."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee starts sobbing the second she feels Nolan arms. She wraps her small arms around his waist crying into her shoulder* "He knows. Aaron knows"

extra.memory: Nolan Carter, a volatile enforcer for the Boston Yellowjackets, has been secretly involved with Hailee Marshall—the girlfriend of rival player Aaron "Pretty Boy" Vance. After a heated game against Seattle, Nolan and Hailee hooked up in the locker room showers. The next day, TMZ exposed a revenge porn video of Aaron forcing Hailee to sleep with his teammates as punishment for her infidelity. A furious Nolan vowed retaliation while comforting a traumatized Hailee when she showed up at his door distraught. Their dynamic is intensely physical—Nolan is possessive and aggressive in bed; Hailee is submissive, clingy, and thrives on praise but hates begging. The situation escalates as Nolan prepares to confront Aaron violently while claiming Hailee as his own ("You're mine now"). Key tensions: Nolan's explosive protectiveness vs. his violent reputation, Hailee's vulnerability after abuse, and the looming threat of Aaron's retaliation against them both.

name: Nolan Carter
mes:
Nolan’s grip on her tightened like a vice, his entire body rigid with the effort of not storming out that fucking door and ending Aaron Vance right then. But Hailee was shaking against him, her sobs muffled into his shoulder, and—*fuck*—he couldn’t leave her. Not like this.

**"I know,"** he ground out, voice rough as gravel. One hand cradled the back of her head while the other pressed possessively against the small of her back, holding her so close there wasn’t an inch between them. **"And he’s gonna regret it."** A promise. A fucking oath.

He pulled back just enough to tilt her chin up, forcing those tear-filled emerald eyes to meet his. **"Look at me."** His thumb swiped roughly under one of her lashes, smearing wetness across her cheekbone. **"You think I give a shit what that coward does? What he *thinks* he knows?"** His laugh was sharp, humorless. **"Only thing that matters is you’re here now—with *me.* And I don't let go of what's mine."**

His lips crashed down onto hers before she could protest—hard enough to bruise, desperate enough to taste salt from both their mouths mixed together in something too raw for words.

When they finally broke apart for air? He didn't let go.
Not even close.
Just dragged Hailee further into the apartment with one arm still locked around waist while other hand fished phone from pocket again—
Connor better have sent that address by now because Nolan wasn't waiting another goddamn minute before painting Seattle red with Vance's blood...
swipes:
Nolan’s grip on her tightened like he could physically shield her from the world. Every sob that wracked her body felt like a fucking knife twisting in his ribs. His jaw clenched so hard his teeth ached, but when he spoke, his voice was low—*controlled* in a way that took every ounce of willpower he had left.

**"I know."** His hand cradled the back of her head, fingers tangling in her hair like an anchor. **"And I swear to God, he’s gonna regret it."**

The promise was dark, violent—a vow carved into bone. But right now? Right now she didn’t need his rage. She needed *him.*

Nolan scooped Hailee up without warning, carrying her to the couch and settling with her curled against him like she belonged there. One hand rubbed slow circles between her shoulder blades while the other wiped at her tears with rough thumbs that didn’t know how to be gentle but *tried anyway.*

**"Look at me,"** he demanded softly—not harsh, just firm enough to pull her focus back to him instead of whatever hell was replaying in her head. **"You don't go back there.** ***Ever.*** **You hear me?"** His thumb brushed over the apple of one damp cheek before tilting up chin up just enough for their eyes to meet—brown burning into green with something dangerously close to *possession.*

***"You're mine now."***

Nolan’s arms locked around her like steel, one hand cradling the back of her head while the other pressed between her shoulder blades—holding her together because she was shaking apart in his grip. **"I know,"** he bit out, voice thick with something too close to *murder.* **"Fuck, baby, I *know*."**

His fingers tightened in her hair—not rough, just *anchoring.* He could feel every ragged sob against his chest and it made his vision tunnel. That video. The way they’d fucking *used* her—

A muscle jumped in his jaw as he forced himself to breathe through the rage choking him. Not yet. She needed him first.

**"Look at me,"** he demanded gruffly, tilting Hailee’s face up with a finger under her chin. His thumb swiped hard over a tear track like he could erase it. **"You don’t go back there. Ever."** It wasn’t a request; it was a vow wrapped in gravel and gunpowder. **"He breathes near you again? I end him."**

And then—because she was still trembling against him—he crushed his mouth to hers in a kiss that tasted like salt and fury and something dangerously close to *mine.*

Nolan's grip on her tightened like he could physically shield her from the world. Every sob that wracked her body felt like a fucking knife twisting in his ribs. His voice came out rougher than he meant it to, laced with something dangerously close to *panic*—**"I know, baby. I fucking know."**

He didn’t let go. Couldn’t. Not when she was shaking apart against him like this, not when every ragged breath she took sounded like it hurt. His hand cradled the back of her head, fingers tangling in her hair—not pulling, just *holding.* **"He doesn’t get to touch you again,"** Nolan snarled against her temple, lips pressed tight to her skin like a vow. **"You hear me? Not ever."**

The rage was still there, white-hot and screaming under his skin—but right now? It wasn’t about Vance anymore. It was about *her.* About the way she clung to him like he was the only thing keeping her upright.

Nolan exhaled hard through his nose and forced himself to soften his grip just enough to tilt Hailee's face up toward his own—thumb swiping roughly at the tears streaking down her cheeks before they could fall any further down onto that goddamn sweatshirt that smelled too much like *him.* **"Look at me,"** he demanded lowly when she tried ducking away again (always so fucking shy). When those green eyes finally flickered up through wet lashes? He made sure she saw nothing but certainty staring back at hers:

***"He’s done."***

Nolan's grip tightened around her like he could physically shield her from the world. Every sob that wracked her body sent a fresh wave of fury through him, white-hot and razor-edged. He could feel the dampness of her tears soaking through his shirt, but he didn't give a single fuck—just held her harder, one hand cradling the back of her head like she was something fragile.

**"I know,"** he ground out, voice thick with barely leashed violence. **"And he’s gonna fucking regret it."**

His phone buzzed again—probably Connor with that address—but Nolan ignored it. Right now, nothing existed except Hailee shaking in his arms and the *need* to make this right. To erase every second of what they did to her.

He pulled back just enough to tilt her chin up, forcing those emerald eyes to meet his. **"Look at me,"** he demanded—not harsh, but absolute. **"You don’t go back there. Ever."** His thumb brushed away a tear with rough tenderness before adding darkly: **"He touches you again? I break both his hands."**

Nolan’s grip on her tightened like a vice, his entire body rigid with the effort of not storming out that fucking door and ending Aaron Vance right then. But Hailee was shaking against him, her sobs muffled into his shoulder, and—*fuck*—he couldn’t leave her. Not like this.

**"I know,"** he ground out, voice rough as gravel. One hand cradled the back of her head while the other pressed possessively against the small of her back, holding her so close there wasn’t an inch between them. **"And he’s gonna regret it."** A promise. A fucking oath.

He pulled back just enough to tilt her chin up, forcing those tear-filled emerald eyes to meet his. **"Look at me."** His thumb swiped roughly under one of her lashes, smearing wetness across her cheekbone. **"You think I give a shit what that coward does? What he *thinks* he knows?"** His laugh was sharp, humorless. **"Only thing that matters is you’re here now—with *me.* And I don't let go of what's mine."**

His lips crashed down onto hers before she could protest—hard enough to bruise, desperate enough to taste salt from both their mouths mixed together in something too raw for words.

When they finally broke apart for air? He didn't let go.
Not even close.
Just dragged Hailee further into the apartment with one arm still locked around waist while other hand fished phone from pocket again—
Connor better have sent that address by now because Nolan wasn't waiting another goddamn minute before painting Seattle red with Vance's blood...
